title: Thoughts on Victorious Sivir
body:
In case you have not seen the skin here's a link to the surr@20 post [[x]](http://www.surrenderat20.net/p/current-pbe-balance-changes.html#newskins)
Keep in mind that these are my _personal opinions_, I am not stating anything as fact, and I am not demanding anything from Riot. I just really wanted to put my thoughts out there.

**Overall Impression**

*     It’s pretty good but I’m not terribly excited to get it, I still like my other Sivir skins better... At this point it’s just a status symbol that will get dusty in the corner of my skins closet.
*     This skin is not nearly as bad as ppl made it out to be tbh

**Bad?**
 
*     Watching the skin spotlight video I am dissapointed to say that her new recall greatly resembles by least fav Sivir skin: Snowflake Snowdown Snowstorm (it’s the splash art, really) I can see that the animators took effort to make the wind-up and the intermediary different, it still holds enough similarity that I make a face when I see it.
*     Her weapon looks super clunky instead of [what the teaser implied](http://polscygracze.pl/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/victorious-teaser_article-banner-1024x576.jpg); a smooth, sharp, and elegant new glaive. I appreciate what they tried to do with the laurels, but but in backfired in that it looks a little gaudy.
*     Boobplate. pretty tame for ya'll and u can't see it in game (b/c of her pose) but I’m not looking forward to the splash art regardless.
*     Purple cloth brings her away from the overall “Victorious“ theme.

**Good!**

*     Tying the purple color and gold laurels into the skin via victory and Sivir’s own royalty.
*     Laurel wreaths were awarded to martial victors once upon a time in Rome and the symbol has expanded from that area and is readily know, and is, quite honestly, a great theme for Sivir to have. 
*     Sivir might be one of the better choices to give purple instead of blue b/c of her lineage, as purple is used to represent royalty and riches.  However, since she seems to regect her royalty...

**Hopes? for a skin that probs won’t change**

*     Gonna be honest, I was hoping for something more, uh, deserty. I would have liked to see it tied into _her_ a little more.
*     imo, laurels should have wreathed her head and been much more subtle on her blade to give her glaive a truer bladed edge
*     Keep with the blue cloth (I’m interested to see how this would look) and give the metal a bright grey tint, rather then a blue one so it doesn’t all blend together.
*     Consider! The silver on Janna or Eliese’s skin looks gorgeous with the gold and blue.
*     Really was hoping for darker skin on this... skin. Not only would it give way to her her ethnicity it would made for lovely contrast with the bight, shiny colors of her clothing.

replies.body: Thanks for the feedback Sealust! Your points are really well laid out. We wanted to move Victorious away from Championship by using some cues from the Roman Empire: Regal Purples and Golden Laurels. The skin should have the same skin tone as her base, I will check on this tomorrow.

Okay, I think I found out why the changes to this skin line hurt more for me than other changes that have occurred recently (like to champion kits). For kits, those can either be a hit or a miss in terms of how players like it or don't. But they can always be changed. For a skin line, especially for one with such prestige as the Victorious Line (and one that's so hard for champs to get into), once something is done/changed/whatever, it's done. Riot doesn't go back and significantly change skins because, let's be honest, it's an unreasonable expectation and a huge undertaking. For that reason, once the damage is done, it's done, no going back, gotta meet the release deadline.

> [{quoted}](name=GhastlyGhoulMan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=zL18mF1Z,comment-id=00010004,timestamp=2015-11-03T16:23:41.650+0000)
>
> Okay, I think I found out why the changes to this skin line hurt more for me than other changes that have occurred recently (like to champion kits). For kits, those can either be a hit or a miss in terms of how players like it or don't. But they can always be changed. For a skin line, especially for one with such prestige as the Victorious Line (and one that's so hard for champs to get into), once something is done/changed/whatever, it's done. Riot doesn't go back and significantly change skins because, let's be honest, it's an unreasonable expectation and a huge undertaking. For that reason, once the damage is done, it's done, no going back, gotta meet the release deadline.

Even still I appreciate your feedback, at the least we can keep it in mind for next year. Right now we have a few esports lines; Championship, Victorious, Challenger, Winning Teams and we may have even more in the future. We felt like it was important that they each have their own design space moving forward because the chance of one champion getting multiple esports skins increases as time goes on. We felt it was important that people don't confuse the skin lines either because if someone thinks you just purchased the 'blue' Elise skin it detracts from your achievement.

As a counterpoint, I don't care if people know I'm gold+ just from the victorious skin. Anyone who cares enough can see I'm gold+ just from op.gg or whatever. I just want the skin to look good, and the purple doesn't really look that good in comparison to the blue.

I really appreciate the response, thank you so much. Even just knowing WHY helps ease the frustration, and knowing that both sides are at least heard and acknowledged.

I do see where you're coming from, and after your response I find that I honestly agree with you guys seeing the need to differentiate the skin lines a bit more. That being said I'll still miss the skin that could have existed had it followed the current Victorious theme. 

As an aside, I friggin love the majority of the skins you guys put out at such a steady tempo. They've made me impulse buy maybe a bit more than I should hehe... ;)

While it looks good, the purple instead of the standard blue is...odd. I think I could get used to that if the blade didn't seem so bland. At least to me, her splash made it look like there would be three curved blades coming off of the handle instead of the gold and silver circle that it is now.

Ty for the reply! 

And totally, i can see why you're moving them apart like that. The more seasons we have, the more having two visually separate skin lines makes sense. I think Sivir is a good choice in starting with this different theme.

The comment about her skin tone was more of a blanket comment about Sivir; I'd like to see her with a darker skin tone, and new skins are opportunities to change shaders a lil bit, I'm always hoping for that lol. I'm pretty sure you're right about it being the same shade on the Victorious as her base.

I'm pretty sure you're right about it being the same shade on the Victorious as her base.

I agree her rework could have been darker, but on skins moving forward we are aiming to preserve base skin tone unless thematically necessary to shift it.
So no more Shyv skins where she is spontaneously a 'normal' white skin tone for no reason?

> [{quoted}](name=Kindlejack,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=zL18mF1Z,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-11-04T17:22:58.795+0000)
>
> I agree her rework could have been darker, but on skins moving forward we are aiming to preserve base skin tone unless thematically necessary to shift it.

Doesn't stop me from hoping.

I have another question, not sure if you can provide any insight but; was wondering why Victorious was chosen as the line to be changed to a roman-esq theme, rather then, say, Championship. 

Not saying it doesn't make sense; the skin requires a trial through combat to receive, and only if you do well enough; it's granted to the 'victors' so to speak.  It's just that the roman thing theme is pretty widely used across the spectrum and the Victorious line seems like something that calls for a more unique theme, something more 'League of Legends'y.
I mean, I guess Rome owned Egypt for a while...

Wait wait wait... You WANTED to change the Victorious line??? That's like saying you want to move the Marauder skin from a dark, coal black color to straight RED, because SO MUCH MURDER AND BLOOD!

... I'm sorry, the tone may be a little better, but I loved the idea that Sivir was getting a skin to join the Victorious line, since I can't have the PAX skin (although we haven't been told WHY Riot won't redistribute those, even at events, just that they won't). But this is a slap in the face, and if I can expect every future Victorious Skin to now be a wannabe Roman Skin... then count me out of ranked from now on. So not worth it.

Edit: I just honestly thought that the skin set was good as is. To me, Championship was like the lesser Victorious that everyone else could buy if they wanted to. Victorious added the gold you get FROM Victory, and could only be achieved through toiling through the sludge of verbal abuse and the struggle of improving your skills that is Ranked mode. It was perfect. Like every person got a piece of the summoner's cup in skin form.

Just... Please stop setting people's expectations then blowing them up for the sake of "different", and " oh, you'll get used to it". At least put some poll or something out before you change a skin line so fundamentally, see what people think. AND MAKE THOSE OPINIONS VISIBLE. Then at least we'll be able to see that, hey, a majority of players DO like the changes, even if I don't. Right now it feels like we just don't know how many people DON'T like this departure from precedence vs how many people do.

Heck, I'll even be okay with the laurels and purple! Just please don't put the laurels on her weapon. Which is arguably the most prominent piece of her skins. Put the laurels somewhere, ANYWHERE else: as paldrons, as a belt, anywhere but the thing you're using to kill people with.

To add my thoughts: After watching all of worlds and hearing the next Victorious skin was for Sivir I did a massive eye roll. The 'over-played allows no fun' adc gets the skin.

Just eehhuugg...

{{champion:429}}

Riot should buff LoL by removing Kalista and Azir from the game.

Sivir is no fun because of her kit design, Kalista is no fun because of her lack of late game counter play.
Why does Sivir allow no fun?

Sivir is a team fight focused adc. When player skill levels are near equal Sivir isnt as strong as other adc's (1v1 or 2v2). She usually has to lane swap (bot lane goes top to trade farm with the enemy bot lane) or the Sivir forfeits her lane either wave clearing and drawing back or waiting for the enemy to push the minion wave to her turret.

So the players dont really fight each other and you'll have low kill games for the first 20-30 minutes. Basically if there is any lane swaps, you might as well fast forward 20 minutes because nothing is going to happen.  :`(
